newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-WestLB gets Australian branch bank authority.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-WestLB gets Australian branch bank authority.

text.p: Westdeustche Landesbank Girozentrale (WestLB) said it has been granted a branch banking authority by the Australian government.

The German bank said a decision to establish a branch in Australia after almost 27 years of representation was taken to cater for the increasing needs of WestLB's local clients and reflects changing domestic conditions.
WestLB will continue to service its already well established Australian corporate, institutional and government relationships via a much broader range of wholesale banking services.
These services, which will be backed by the bank's AA plus credit rating, will include specialist services in the areas of project and structured finance, corporate finance and treasury.

WestLB said its services will continue to be supported by other existing operations in Australia, through its wholly owned subsidiary WestLB Securities Australia Ltd and the representative office of West Merchant Bank Ltd.
